profile_positions.title: Lead Senior Completions & Well Intervention Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Overall responsible for ZETAH E&P Congo, onshore completions, well services & work-over activities. Co-
ordinating, programming and planning the operations, within the set production and drilling planning. The
Mboudi new development, concession was taken over from TOTAL, planned to have 150 wells drilled and
completed of which 40 have been successfully drilled, completed and put into production prior my departure
from the company. Further responsibilities and deliverables:

    Preparing scope of work for tendering of equipment and services.
    Selecting via technical and cost evaluations equipment and services, negotiated final contracts and
    placed purchase orders.
    Designed and prepare work programs for the Well Completions, Stimulations, Testing and well
    interventions.
    Daily operational responsibility for Well Completions, Work-Overs and well interventions.
    Prepared and controlled budget and contractual costs associated with daily operations.

TOTAL E&P CONGO
Drilling, Completions & Work-over Superintendent                             July 2004 - January 2005
Overall responsible for TOTAL E&P Congo offshore completions, work-over and Well Intervention activities.
    Developed work over and well intervention designs.
    Managed and co-ordinate work-over and well intervention activities within the set production and drilling
    planning.
    Daily well interventions pertaining to wire-line, well completions, coiled tubing, stimulation and electric line
    operations.
    Prepared and controlled budget and contractual costs associated with daily operations.
profile_positions.title: Well Services & Completion Superintendent at Maurel & Prom The Congo
Senior completions and well intervention engineer

profile_positions.description:
World Wide Completions / Well Services Manager (Oct 2000 ­July 2004)
Manage teams world wide of engineers/superintendents who are responsible for provision of engineering
technical support for well planning, operations and performance monitoring with the following deliverables:

    Design wells (well testing, completions, well interventions and workover programs) and develop
    procedures to deliver optimum performance (operational and well performance).
    Manage all engineering for well design (well testing, well interventions, completions and workover
    designs), monitoring and reporting activities.
    Manage cost estimation, cost studies and cost control activities.
    Specify order and accept all materials and services.
    Develop and maintain business and engineering systems and processes.
    Measure, monitor and benchmark Completions / Well Services performance indicators.
    Identify and implement technical improvement initiatives for well optimisation. Introduced the first offshore
    rack and pinion work-over unit in the world to replace the need of a hydraulic snubbing unit. Been
    responsible for the implementation of intelligent completions in Liverpool bay.
    Provide technical support to the International Business Development Team.
    Main focus of activities are HP/HT platform gas wells in the Golf of Mexico, Trinidad (design face,
    development commence 2004), sub sea development Australia, offshore UKCS (Irish Sea and North
    Sea), Pakistan, Algeria, (2 land development projects Ohanet & Rod) and been involved in the process of
    trying to capture new projects in the Middle East, and Russia.
World Wide Completions / Well Services Engineering
profile_positions.title: Worldwide completion and well intervention manager
World wide completion and well intervention manager

profile_positions.description:
Within the Engineering and Methods section I was responsible for the design, procurement of equipment,
program writing and execution of all completion's, DST well testing, down hole production well maintenance,
standard and exotic well intervention methods, such as well stimulation with and without coiled tubing, slick
line, production logging for reservoir surveillance, perforating, production logging with coiled tubing and
electric line on horizontal wells, rig and hydraulic work-over operations. I was responsible for the following
completed previous projects: F15-A1-A2-A3 vertical and horizontal HT/HP platform wells, K6-N1 platform
well, K6-DN3-DN4-DN5 platform wells, K5-A1-A2-D1-D2 and B1-B2 platform wells, L7H1 and Middenmeer-1
Hydraulic work over, Wirdum-3 and Leeuwarden-6 hydraulic abandonment and several DST operations on
offshore exploration wells. Furthermore I was responsible for the design and execution of a velocity string
campaign on six land wells and one offshore well, well frac operations, the coiled tubing under balanced
deepening of the horizontal drain on the Zuidwal-A8 well in 1996, 3 hydraulic workovers and the velocity
string installation campaign on 5 wells in 1997. Completed the design, programs and preparations for the
profile_positions.title: and Completions Superintendent

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for interior based company well services operations. Maintained technical integrity, continuity
and quality control of all well services associated operations covering approximately 200 oil wells producing
400,000 bbls/day. Section comprised of two Shell International Well services supervisors, five Contractor
Field Supervisors and Well Services Workshop. Scope of operations included 9 Drilling rigs and one
Workover rig, 4 contract wireline crews, 2 exploration contracted well test packages, installation and
operating early production facilities coiled tubing and stimulation contractors, contractor electric line
operations such as SBHP, FBHP's, PLT, s and TDT, s for reservoir surveillance and dynamic surveys and
perforating. Control of daily allowable production deferment. Prepared and controlled budget and contractual
costs associated with daily operations.
profile_positions.title: Senior Well Services / Completions Superintendent

profile_positions.description:
Head Of Well Services Nederlands (Schiedam)
Overall responsibility for well services operations for the western part of the Netherlands. Maintained
technical integrity, continuity and quality control of all well services associated operations. Section comprised
of four national NAM senior supervisors and eight contract well services supervisors. Scope of operations
included co-ordinating, programming, planning and managing daily operations pertaining to wireline, well
completion's, well testing, coiled tubing, stimulation, beam pump workover hoist operations and well
abandonment's projects. Prepared and controlled budget and contractual costs associated with daily
operations.; Operational control of all NAM offshore Well Services and Completion activities. Co-ordinating, programming
and planning, within the set production targets, daily well interventions pertaining to wireline, well
completion's, well testing, coiled tubing, stimulation and electric line operations for reservoir surveillance.
profile_positions.title: Senior Well Services/Completion Engineer
